intro: Boechera hastatula, commonly known as the rockcress or the Sierra rockcress, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Boechera hastatula features small, white or pale yellow flowers and has a basal rosette of leaves. It is known for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
